definition-item.definition-title: BODY DETAILS OR KINDS OF RAILWAY VEHICLES (vehicles in general B60; adaptation of vehicles to special systems B61B; underframes B61F)

section-body.paragraph-text: Constructional features of the body of railway vehicles and the different types of railroad freight cars. It covers also details and arrangement of interior equipment, e.g. chairs, tables.

table-column.paragraph-text: Adaptation of vehicles to special systems

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Carriages for ordinary railway passenger traffic (mine cars B61D11/00; tramcars B61D13/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangement details for sleeping and seating facilities in the carriages of railway vehicles to increase comfort and loading capacity. This main-group covers also arrangement in multiple deck, e.g. double deck, carriages.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Superstructure for passenger vehicles with more than one deck

definition-item.definition-title: General arrangements in sleeping or couchette carriages (B61D1/08 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Arrangement details of sleeping or couchette accomodation inside the railway vehicles. See example drawing:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sleeping arrangement for multiple deck carriages

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: General arrangements of seats (B61D1/06 takes precedence; seats per se B61D33/00)

table-column.paragraph-text: Seat arrangement for multiple deck carriages

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Details of seats and accessories therefore

definition-item.definition-title: Wagons or vans (tank wagons B61D5/00; hopper wagons B61D7/00; tipping wagons B61D9/00; mine cars B61D11/00; vehicles specially adapted for animal transportation B60P3/04; {container traffic B65G})

section-body.paragraph-text: Details and arrangements of railway cars for transporting goods.

list-item.paragraph-text: Railway wagons for carrying road vehicles.
Low level freight wagons.
Swivel platform for rail vehicles.
Convertible freight cars.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Vehicles specially adapted for animal transportation
Auxiliary measures taken in connection with loading/unloading

definition-item.definition-title: with movable floors, e.g. rotatable or floors which can be raised or lowered

section-body.paragraph-text: The vehicle is able to raise, lower or rotate at least part of the floor, e.g. a container could be rotated by the floor from a first position in which the container is parallel to the roadway to a second position in which the container is parallel to the railway vehicle. The drawing shows an example:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {specially adapted for heavy vehicles, e.g. public work vehicles, trucks, trailers}

section-body.paragraph-text: A rail transport vehicle for carrying a hydraulic crawler crane.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Articulated vehicles comprising running gear interconnected by loads

definition-item.definition-title: Tank wagons for carrying fluent materials

section-body.paragraph-text: Railroad rolling stock designed for transporting liquid and gaseous commodities. This main-group further covers design and improvements of the container as also devices and methods for filling and emptying the railroad tank car.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Hopper cars (flat bottomed cars convertible into hoppers B61D3/06)

section-body.paragraph-text: Railroad freight cars used to transport loose bulk commodities such as coal, ore, grain, track ballast, and the like. This main-group comprises also devices and methods, e.g. closure elements, for discharging the freight from the hopper cars.

table-column.paragraph-text: Flat bottoned cars convertible into hoppers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Tipping wagons

section-body.paragraph-text: Goods wagons designed primarily for the transportation of bulk goods and can usually be tipped, dumped or shovelled.

definition-item.definition-title: Mine cars (B61D5/00 - B61D9/00 take precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: Railroad wagons specially adapted to be used as mining cars.

definition-item.definition-title: Tramway vehicles

section-body.paragraph-text: Tramways for public transport, used principally in the city.

definition-item.definition-title: Other railway vehicles, e.g. scaffold cars; Adaptations of vehicles for use on railways (conveyor frames mounted for movement on rail tracks B65G41/02; wheeled machines used in permanent way construction or maintenance E01B)

section-body.paragraph-text: Peculiar railway vehicles that are not in B61D1/00 - B61D13/00.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Electric devices for preventing crash collisions
Conveyor frames mounted for movement on rail tracks
Wheeled machines used in permanent way construction or maintenance

definition-item.definition-title: Buffer cars; Arrangements or construction of railway vehicles for protecting them in case of collisions (buffers B61G11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Rail vehicle having a driver's cab provided with an energy-absorbing structure adapted to cope with a collision above the frame of the vehicle.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Construction details of vehicle bodies (for tank wagons B61D5/00; for hopper cars B61D7/00; body details specially adapted for tipping wagons B61D9/06; for mine cars B61D11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Details of designing the structure of the vehicle body. This main-group also comprises details of interior walls, end walls, sides, floors, roofs and internal lining of the vehicle body.

list-item.paragraph-text: Modular double-decker passenger carriage for railway car.
Lightweight profiles of a railway vehicle body.
Aerodynamic drag reducing devices.
Communication passage, e.g. of the bellow type.
Improved vehicle insulation and method for making using same.
Height adjustable floor of a railway vehicle.

table-column.paragraph-text: Body details specially adapted for tipping wagons

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: reducing air resistance by modifying contour {; Constructional features for fast vehicles sustaining sudden variations of atmospheric pressure, e.g. when crossing in tunnels}

section-body.paragraph-text: Rail vehicle has rail vehicle ends that are aerodynamically arranged such that rail vehicle is provided with low driving resistance.
Covering for a bogie of a rail vehicle for reducing the aerodynamic drag
Streamlined rail vehicle front end for better aerodynamics.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: End walls

section-body.paragraph-text: End wall construction of railway vehicle bodies or details thereof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sides

section-body.paragraph-text: Side wall construction of railway vehicle bodies or details thereof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Hatches in roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: A railroad car with a hatch cover for releasably closing a hatch opening in a roof of a railroad hopper car.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Door arrangements specially adapted for rail vehicles (locks for vehicles E05B77/00-E05B85/00; door-operating mechanisms E05F)

section-body.paragraph-text: Details of doors arrangements for railway vehicles. It concerns also methods and devices for operation of the vehicle doors.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
Power-operated mechanisms for wings, e.g. motorisation, actuation, safety devices are classified in E05F15/00 and its subgroups.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Application of doors, windows, wings or fittings thereof for gates of railway cars or mass transit vehicles

definition-item.definition-title: Construction of steps for railway vehicles (ladders in general E06C)

section-body.paragraph-text: The title of this group is self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Window arrangements peculiar to rail vehicles (vehicle window arrangements in general B60J; cleaning vehicle windows B60S; heating arrangements specially adapted for transparent or reflecting areas H05B3/84)

section-body.paragraph-text: The title of this group is self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heating arrangements specially adapted for transparent or reflecting areas

definition-item.definition-title: Heating, cooling, ventilating, or air-conditioning {(heating, cooling or ventilating devices for vehicles in general B60H1/00; devices for moistening air in vehicles B60H3/02; devices for filtering air in vehicles B60H3/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices and methods for heating, cooling, ventilating passenger carriages as also for refrigerating railroad freight cars.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heating, cooling or ventilating devices for vehicles in general
Devices for moistening air in vehicles
Devices for filtering air in vehicles

definition-item.definition-title: Lighting

section-body.paragraph-text: The title of this group is self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.

list-item.paragraph-text: Arrangement for emergency illumination of emergency exit in rail vehicles.
Passenger compartment lighting device for rail vehicles.
Headlamp and signaling lights for railway vehicles.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sleeping accommodation

section-body.paragraph-text: The title of this group is self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Seats

section-body.paragraph-text: Details and accessories of seats for railway vehicle, seating arrangement and attachment of seats in the vehicle compartment, as also safety seats.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sanitation

section-body.paragraph-text: The titles of this group are self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Water-closets or urinals with flushing devices

definition-item.definition-title: Other furniture or furnishings

section-body.paragraph-text: Details of furniture that are not covered in B61D29/00 and B61D35/00.

list-item.paragraph-text: Foldable tables
Universal computer support
Drink holder

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Wagon or like covers; Tarpaulins; Movable or foldable roofs

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices and methods for covering/uncovering railway cars, specially used for freight vehicles.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {telescopic}

section-body.paragraph-text: Railway wagon covered by telescopically movable roofs.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Indicators for reserved seats; Warning or like signs; Devices or arrangements in connection with tickets, e.g. ticket holders; Holders for cargo tickets or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: The titles of this group are self-explanatory and does not need to be more specified.

definition-item.definition-title: Devices for using the energy of the movements of the vehicles

section-body.paragraph-text: All types of devices using the movement of the vehicle to provide energy.

list-item.paragraph-text: Regenerative train brakes
Bogies comprising flywheel and prime mover
Axle-driven generators
Generators in wheel set bearing

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Means or devices for securing or supporting the cargo, including protection against shocks (for vehicles in general B60P7/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: Devices and methods for securing a load on the railway freight car.

list-item.paragraph-text: Cable tightening devices and load binders.
Railway car loading rack.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Securing of load in vehicle in general

definition-item.definition-title: Loading or unloading devices combined with vehicles, e.g. loading platforms, {doors convertible into loading and unloading ramps} (combined with vehicles in general B60P)

section-body.paragraph-text: The titles of this group are self-explanatory and do not need to be more specified.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Loading/unloading devices for vehicles in general

definition-item.definition-title: Other details

section-body.paragraph-text: Body details and kinds of railway vehicles that are not covered in B61D1/00 - B61D47/00.

list-item.paragraph-text: On-board display systems.
Passenger information system for inside rail vehicle.
Overhead wiring arrangement for a railway car.
Railway swimming poolcar.
Handgrips for use in a railway passenger vehicle.
